intro: Senecio ervendbergii, commonly known as the Ervendberg's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear or lance-shaped, and it produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
